title: Start the Week - BBC Radio 4
synopsis: Anne McElvoy looks back at the life of the maverick scientist James Lovelock who pioneered the theory of Gaia, of a self-regulating Earth. Lovelock also looks to the future and the next evolution of Gaia which could lead to the extinction of human life, and a rise of Artificial Intelligence, but the writer and ecologist George Monbiot prefers his future world with wolves, wild boars and beavers living alongside humans. The UN's intergovernmental panel on climate change has warned to expect more volatile weather patterns, and the physicist Joanna Haigh ex

title: The Life Scientific - BBC Radio 4
synopsis: It's a scientific theory that's had an impact way beyond the world of science: Gaia has been embraced by poets, philosophers, spiritual leaders and green activists. Vaclav Haval called it "a moral prescription for the welfare of the planet".

title: 100 Million Years From Now
synopsis: Earth's landmasses were not always what they are today. Continents formed as Earth's crustal plates shifted and collided over long periods of time.

title: Abiogenesis
synopsis: Abiogenesis (Brit.: /ˌeɪˌbaɪoʊˈdʒɛnᵻsᵻs, -ˌbaɪə-, -ˌbiːoʊ-, -ˌbiːə-/ AY-by-oh-JEN-ə-siss or AY-bee-oh-JEN-ə-siss) or biopoiesis or OoL (Origins of Life), is the natural process of life arising from non-living matter, such as simple organic compounds. It is thought to have occurred on Earth between 3.8 and 4.1 billion years ago, and is studied through a combination of laboratory experiments and extrapolation from the genetic information of modern organisms in order to make reasonable conjectures about what pre-life chemical reactions may have given rise t

title: Actual World
synopsis: The [[Actual World]] is a place to learn, visualise and document how [[Law]] derived and tested in online communities is applied to the [[Real World]].

title: Animals
synopsis: [[Minecraft]] also contains the following non-animal mobs:

title: Asexual Plant Reproduction
synopsis: Plants have two main types of asexual reproduction in which new plants are produced that are genetically identical clones of the parent individual - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plant_reproduction#Asexual_reproduction wikipedia]

title: Attraction Strategies
synopsis: Flowers are [[Attraction Strategies]] and [[Sexual Expressions]] are functional strategies used to produce the next generation of plants, with pollinators and plants having co-evolved, often to some extraordinary degrees, very often rendering mutual benefit.

title: Autonomy
synopsis: Autonomy (from αὐτο- auto- "self" and νόμος nomos, "law", hence when combined understood to mean:

title: Autopoiesis
synopsis: "Autopoiesis" (from Greek αὐτo- (auto-), meaning "self", and ποίησις (poiesis), meaning "creation, production") refers to a system capable of reproducing and maintaining itself - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Autopoiesis wikipedia]

title: Autopoietic Sculpture
synopsis: Autopoietic sculpture is a sculptural object that has the ability to replace regenerate, or otherwise garner energy from the environment to reproduce itself.

title: Biodiversity
synopsis: Biodiversity is the degree of variation of life. It is a measure of the variety of organisms present in different ecosystems.

title: Biome
synopsis: Biomes are regions in a [[Minecraft]] world with varying geographical features, flora, heights, temperatures, humidity ratings, and sky and foliage colors - [http://minecraft.gamepedia.com/Biome gamepedia.com]

title: Blockchain Integration Framework
synopsis: Some notes on the framework we are developing to integrate [[Minecraft]] with the [[Blockchain]].

title: Business Insider
synopsis: Our mission: to tell you all you need to know about the big world around you - [http://www.businessinsider.com/ businessinsider.com]

title: Cambrian explosion
synopsis: The Cambrian explosion, or less commonly Cambrian radiation, was the relatively short evolutionary event, beginning around 542 million years ago in the Cambrian Period, during which most major animal phyla appeared, as indicated by the fossil record.

title: CFC
synopsis: A page with 1 items.

title: Changes to this Site
synopsis: Below we list recent changes to this site only without also listing changes from the [[Neighbourhood]]:

synopsis: Climate Hope City is a project by the Guardian Newspaper to map environmental projects in Minecraft - [http://www.theguardian.com/environment/keep-it-in-the-ground-blog/2015/jun/12/climate-hope-city-how-minecraft-can-tell-the-story-of-climate-change?CMP=EMCENVEML1631 theguardian.com]

title: Coevolution
synopsis: - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coevolution wikipedia]

title: Combat Climate Change
synopsis: Take urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts.

title: Computer simulation
synopsis: A computer simulation is a simulation, run on a single computer, or a network of computers, to reproduce behavior of a system - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Computer_simulation wikipedia]

title: Currently Working On
synopsis: Here is a list of [[Recent Changes]] I consider important. View our experiments on the [[Scratch]] page. To clear stuff saved in your browser try [[Local Changes]].

title: Daisy
synopsis: A page with 1 items.

title: Daisy Maps
synopsis: There is a site which lists [[Minecraft Maps]] that you can download. Daisyville can be found here - [http://www.minecraftworldmap.com/worlds/ZDbmp#/-51/64/634/max/0/0 minecraftworldmap.com]

title: Daisy World
synopsis: Daisy World is loosely modelled on [[James Lovelock]]'s [[Daisyworld]], but based in Minecraft where we can make use of the extensive environmental infrastructure of [[Biomes]], [[Plants]] and [[Animals]].

title: Daisyworld
synopsis: Daisyworld, a [[Computer Simulation]], is a hypothetical world orbiting a star whose radiant energy is slowly increasing or decreasing.

title: Dark matter
synopsis: Dark matter is an unidentified type of matter comprising approximately 27% of the mass and energy in the observable universe that is not accounted for by dark energy, baryonic matter (ordinary matter), and neutrinos - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dark_matter wikipedia]

title: Data Visualisation
synopsis: The [[Dreamcraft Academy]] will engage [[Artists]] and data visualisation [[Experts]] in graphically representing, organising, clustering the [[Million Tweets]] that we aim to collect during the [[Tweet a Dream]] campaign.

title: Decent Work for All
synopsis: Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all.

title: Demographics of Minecraft
synopsis: Since its release on the PC in the spring of 2009, Minecraft, developed by Mojang, has become one of the most popular video games in the world. Attracting both hard-core gamers and casuals.

title: Docker for Minecraft
synopsis: There is a [[Docker for Minecraft]] which allows you to run various servers. By default the container will run the selected “vanilla” (aka official) Minecraft server, but you can also choose to run the LATEST or a specific version of a Forge server - [https://registry.hub.docker.com/u/itzg/minecraft-server/ registry.hub.docker.com]

title: Docker on a Pi
synopsis: There are a number of ways of getting Docker running on a Raspberry Pi. The best two strategies we came across were:

title: Dream Crafting
synopsis: [[DreamCraft]] is a place where dreams can be crafted, refined and debated in magical model of the earth built in [[Minecraft]].

title: Dreamcraft Academy
synopsis: The [[Dreamcraft Academy]] is an [[Open Education]] space and [[Research Group]] where we learn together how to code and build in [[Minecraft]] in order to create [[Minecraft Law]].

title: Dreams
synopsis: A quick example of how easy it is to share and organise, and write stories about our shared dreams!

title: Early Computer Simulation
synopsis: Computer simulation developed hand-in-hand with the rapid growth of the computer, following its first large-scale deployment during the [[Manhattan Project]] in [[World War II]] to model the process of nuclear detonation ([[nuclear weapon]]) - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Computer_Simulation#History wikipedia]

title: Earth's energy budget
synopsis: Earth's energy budget accounts for the energy Earth receives from the Sun. Much of this energy is lost when the earth re-radiates it back into outer space, and the rest of the energy is distributed throughout the five components of Earth's climate system. This system is made up of earth's water, ice, atmosphere, rocky crust, and all living things - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Earth%27s_energy_budget wikipedia]

title: Electron capture detector
synopsis: An electron capture detector (ECD) is a device for detecting atoms and molecules in a gas through the attachment of electrons via electron capture ionization. The device was invented in 1957 by James Lovelock and is used in gas chromatography to detect trace amounts of chemical compounds in a sample - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electron_capture_detector wikipedia]

title: Electron Capture Device
synopsis: Earlier in his career (in 1960), [[James Lovelock]] developed the [[Electron Capture Device]], a highly sensitive detector for measuring air pollution.

title: Empower all Women and Girls
synopsis: Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls.

title: End Hunger
synopsis: End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture.

title: End Poverty
synopsis: End poverty in all its forms everywhere.

title: Energy Backed Currencies
synopsis: From an excellent article on the site of the Schumacher Society by Robert Swann, called “The Place of a Local Currency in a World Economy” - [http://www.schumachersociety.org/newsletters/04jun18.html http://p2pfoundation.net/Energy-Backed_Currencies schumachersociety.org]

title: Europe Under Water
synopsis: Bug: we don't seem to be able to embed these Youtube annottations videos.

title: Evolution of Sex
synopsis: Many protists reproduce sexually, as do the multicellular plants, animals, and fungi. In the eukaryotic fossil record, sexual reproduction first appeared by 1.2 billion years ago in the Proterozoic Eon.

title: Extremophile
synopsis: An extremophile (from Latin extremus meaning "extreme" and Greek philiā (φιλία) meaning "love") is an organism that thrives in physically or geochemically extreme conditions that are detrimental to most life on Earth. In contrast, organisms that live in more moderate environments may be termed mesophiles or neutrophiles.

title: Fedwiki Tools
synopsis: Here we list a few tools that are of particular use in managing and creating [[Fedwiki]] content.

title: Flower Forest
synopsis: The flower forest [[Biome]] is a great place to see lot's of flowers :)

title: Flowering plants
synopsis: Flowering plants are the dominant plant form on land and they reproduce by sexual and asexual means. Often their most distinguishing feature is their reproductive organs, commonly called flowers - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plant_reproduction#Flowering_plants wikipedia]

title: Flowers in Minecraft
synopsis: Flowers are naturally occurring [[Plants]] that come in a variety of shapes and colors - [http://minecraft.gamepedia.com/Flower gamepedia.com]

title: Fluently Exploring Morphospace
synopsis: Dynamical patterning modules: a "pattern language" for development and evolution of multicellular form.

title: Flying in Virtual Worlds
synopsis: Both Second Life and Minecraft make use of the simulation of flying. This is a good learner activity for developing skills in hand-eye-avatar coordination before attempting more complex on-ground virtual navigation.

title: Form World
synopsis: Form World is a world that runs the [[Bureaucracy]] of [[The Federation]]. It is a [[Minecraft World]] that contains the [[Forms]], the [[Lawyers]], and [[The Ideals]] of [[The Federation]].

title: Foster Innovation
synopsis: Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation.

title: Gaia
synopsis: Gaia theory is the notion that systems are able to organise their environment in order to ensure their own survival - even if these systems are inanimate (like a planet).

synopsis: Hinduism, Buddhism, Christianity, Judaism, and Islam are five of the biggest religions in the world.

synopsis: First-person Hyperlapse Videos (Technical) by Johannes Kopf, et. al. Timelapse stabilization from moving point of view. [http://research.microsoft.com/en-us/um/redmond/projects/hyperlapse/ page]

title: Ice Plains Spikes
synopsis: A relatively rare variation of the Ice Plains [[Biome]] that features snow blocks and large spikes of packed ice, on which snow will later fall.

title: If All The Ice Melted
synopsis: We learned last year that many of the effects of climate change are irreversible. Sea levels have been rising at a greater rate year after year, and the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change estimates they could rise by another meter or more by the end of this century.

title: Inclusive Industrialization
synopsis: Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation.

title: James Lovelock
synopsis: Anne McElvoy looks back at the life of the maverick scientist James Lovelock who pioneered the theory of Gaia, of a self-regulating Earth. Lovelock also looks to the future and the next evolution of Gaia which could lead to the extinction of human life, and a rise of Artificial Intelligence, but the writer and ecologist George Monbiot prefers his future world with wolves, wild boars and beavers living alongside humans. The UN's intergovernmental panel on climate change has warned to expect more volatile weather patterns, and the physicist Joanna Haigh ex

title: Johan Gielis
synopsis: Even Gielis was amazed at the range when he plugged it into modelling software. “All these beautiful shapes came rolling out,” he told Nature. “It seemed too good to be true—I spent two years thinking, What did I do wrong? and How come no one else has discovered it?” Gielis called his equation the Superformula - [http://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2015/05/18/world-without-end-raffi-khatchadourian newyorker.com/]

title: Law as an Autopoietic System
synopsis: [[Law as an Autopoietic System]] by Gunther Teubner - [http://books.google.co.uk/books/about/Autopoietic_law.html?id=FQ86iEJy1DgC&redir_esc=y books.google.co.uk]

title: Laws of Form
synopsis: Laws of Form is a book by G. Spencer-Brown, published in 1969, that straddles the boundary between mathematics and philosophy - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Laws_of_Form wikipedia]

title: Life Begat Continents
synopsis: Why is Earth the only planet with plate tectonics? And, when did they start? The clues are so faint, the traces so ephemeral, that researchers are only now beginning to find tentative answers. Extraordinarily, some say that life itself has changed the forces in plate tectonics, and helped to shape the world. [http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/p01bt3wn bbc]

title: Lifelong Learning
synopsis: Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all.

title: LIMUN
synopsis: The London International [[Model United Nations]] (LIMUN) is a charitable organization, registered with the Charity Commission for England and Wales (number 1096197), that hosts an annual three-day Model United Nations conference in London, United Kingdom, since 2000.

title: Liquid Democracy
synopsis: Liquid Democracy is a combination of [[Direct Democracy]], and [[Representative Democracy]]. It aims to create a more flexible and fluid way for people to express their [[Democratic Preference]].

title: Look after the Oceans
synopsis: Conserve and sustainably use the oceans, seas and marine resources for sustainable development.

title: Many Worlds
synopsis: Creation of Many Words in Building Utopia project refers to possibility to create alternate realities.

title: Mega Taiga
synopsis: Mega taiga is an uncommon [[Biome]] composed of spruce trees, much like the standard [[Taiga]] biome - [http://minecraft.gamepedia.com/Ice_Plains_Spikes#Cold_biomes gamepedia]

title: Minecraft
synopsis: Minecraft is a [[Sandbox Video Game]] written in Java originally created by Markus "Notch" Persson, and now maintained by Mojang AB. It is heavily inspired by Infiniminer.

title: Minecraft Art
synopsis: There have been a number of art projects made in or about Minecraft:

title: Minecraft Earth
synopsis: The Earth Map for Minecraft actually allows you to play a [[Minecraft Map]] that very closely resembles Earth itself. This map was generated using various images from Nasa, and specs like landmass, elevation and even vegetation were all included!

title: Minecraft Forge
synopsis: Minecraft Forge is a Minecraft application programming interface ([[API]]) which allows almost maximum compatibility between other Forge mods - [http://www.minecraftforge.net/wiki/Minecraft_Forge minecraftforge.net]

title: Minecraft in Schools
synopsis: Minecraft Is Now Free In All Secondary Schools In Northern Ireland - [http://www.theguardian.com/technology/2015/mar/25/minecraft-free-secondary-school-northern-island theguardian.com]

title: Minecraft Law
synopsis: Minecraft-law is the [[Techno-Legal]] integration of [[Minecraft]] and the [[Blockchain]].

title: Minecraft Pi
synopsis: This page is about running a [[Minecraft Server]] on a [[Raspberry Pi 2]]:

title: Minecraft Plugin API
synopsis: Bukkit didn't get DMCA'd, Craftbukkit did. Craftbukkit is the server software, [[Bukkit]] is just the API. Also, [[Spigot]] (an alternate version of Craftbukkit) is alive and updating (well, you have to compile it yourself using their buildtools system, but anyway). 99.9% of [[Bukkit Plugins]] work on spigot.

title: No Man's Sky
synopsis: No Man's Sky is an action-adventure survival video game developed and published by the indie studio Hello Games for PlayStation 4 and Microsoft Windows. The game was released worldwide in August 2016 - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/No_Man%27s_Sky wikipedia]

title: Open Education
synopsis: This is an example page - feel free to edit!

title: Open World
synopsis: Open world is a concept for video game where a player can roam freely through a virtual world and is given considerable freedom in choosing how or when to approach objectives, while some computer games have a linear structure.

title: Origin of Sex
synopsis: - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Evolution_of_sexual_reproduction#Origin_of_sexual_reproduction wikipedia]

title: Origins of Life
synopsis: Life started almost as soon as the planet was formed - somewhere between 3.8 and 4.1 billion years ago.

title: Peaceful and Inclusive Societies
synopsis: Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels.

title: Plant Intelligence
synopsis: Plants behave in some oddly intelligent ways: fighting predators, maximizing food opportunities ... But can we think of them as actually having a form of intelligence of their own?

title: Plant Reproduction
synopsis: Plant reproduction can be accomplished by sexual or asexual reproduction. Asexual reproduction takes two main forms: [[Vegetative Reproduction]] and [[Apomixis]] - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plant_reproduction wikipedia]

title: Plant Sexual History
synopsis: Unlike animals, plants are immobile, and cannot seek out sexual partners for reproduction. In the evolution of early plants, abiotic means, including water and wind, transported sperm for reproduction - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plant_reproduction#History_of_sexual_reproduction wikipedia]

title: Plant Sexual Morphology
synopsis: Many plants have evolved complex sexual reproductive systems, which is expressed in different combinations of their reproductive organs.

title: Plantoid
synopsis: A plantoid is a hypothetical robot or synthetic organism designed to look, act and grow like a plant. Hello this is wrong.

title: Plants
synopsis: Plants are [[Minecraft]]'s representation of plant life. They do not move, but some can grow and spread under the right conditions. Most plants can be planted and farmed. All plants occur naturally in the [[Overworld]], with the exception of [[Nether Warts]] - [http://minecraft.gamepedia.com/Plants gamepedia.com]

title: Pollination
synopsis: In plants that use insects or other animals to move pollen from one flower to the next, plants have developed greatly modified flower parts to attract pollinators and to facilitate the movement of pollen from one flower to the insect and from the insect back to the next flower - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plant_reproduction#Pollination wikipedia]

title: Pollinator
synopsis: A pollinator is the biotic agent (vector) that moves pollen from the male anthers of a flower to the female stigma of a flower to accomplish fertilization or 'syngamy' of the female gametes in the ovule of the flower by the male gametes from the pollen grain. [[Anthecology]] is the scientific study of pollination - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pollinator wikipedia]

title: Pretty Wiki
synopsis: Pretty wiki is a minimal rendering of wiki, without the wobble, or clutter of the journal. It is a deferential design of wiki that emphasises reading - a way to publish content from [http://livecode.world/pretty_wiki.html wiki]

title: Procedural generation
synopsis: In computing, procedural generation is a method of creating data algorithmically as opposed to manually. In computer graphics it is also called random generation and is commonly used to create textures and 3D models - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Procedural_generation wikipedia]

title: Protect our Ecosystems
synopsis: Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss.

title: Real World
synopsis: Reality is considered to be the conjectured state of things as they actually exist, rather than as they may appear or might be imagined. In a wider definition, reality includes everything that is and has been, whether or not it is observable or comprehensible. A still broader definition includes everything that has existed, exists, or will exist.

title: Reality
synopsis: Here we look at the relationship between [[Minecraft]] and reality.

title: Recent Changes
synopsis: Here we list neighborhood pages with those most recently changed listed first. See also the [[Scratch]] page and [[Local Changes]] for work in progress.

title: Reduce Inequality
synopsis: Reduce inequality within and among countries.

title: Rhizome
synopsis: In botany and dendrology, a rhizome is a modified subterranean stem of a plant that is usually found underground, often sending out roots and shoots from its nodes.

title: Safe, and Resilient Cities
synopsis: Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable.

title: Salvatore Iaconesi
synopsis: Salvatore is a designer, robotics engineer, artist, hacker and principal and co-founder of Art is Open Source.

title: Sandbox Video Game
synopsis: A Sandbox game is a game that the player has the ability to alter their environment in some substantial matter, hence the term sandbox.

title: Scale Of The Universe
synopsis: Ranging from the unimaginably small to the unimaginably big, the scale of the universe is mind-boggling. Watch to try to wrap your head around it.

title: Scratch
synopsis: A page with 0 items.

title: Shadow Election
synopsis: Mission: to capture and highlight global opinions so strongly that political leaders are better informed and motivated to solve global issues. And to promote and empower individuals selected by a vast community of globally-concerned citizens to represent these opinions, and provide them with networked resources to help ensure the universally endorsed solutions are carried out for the benefit of all nations - [http://shadowelection.com/ shadowelection.com].

title: Simulation versus model
synopsis: A [[computer model]] is the algorithms and equations used to capture the behavior of the system being modeled. By contrast, computer simulation is the actual running of the program that contains these equations or algorithms. Simulation, therefore, is the process of running a model. Thus one would not "build a simulation"; instead, one would "build a model", and then either "run the model" or equivalently "run a simulation" - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Computer_Simulation#Simulation_versus_model wikipedia]

title: Sol LeWitt
synopsis: Solomon "Sol" LeWitt was an American artist linked to various movements, including Conceptual art and Minimalism - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sol_LeWitt wikipedia]

title: Solar REC
synopsis: Solar Renewable Energy Certificates (SRECs) or Solar Renewable Energy Credits are a form of Renewable Energy Certificate or "Green tag" - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Solar_Renewable_Energy_Certificate wikipedia]

title: SolarCoin
synopsis: SolarCoin is a digital currency distributed to incentivize 97,500 TWh of Solar energy over 40 years. SolarCoin is backed by a 3rd party verified facility representing 1 MWh of generated solar electricity- [http://wiki.solarcoin.org/index.php?title=Main_Page wiki.solarcoin.org]

title: Spread Of Mankind
synopsis: Here's how early humans spread from East Africa all around the world.

title: Starch
synopsis: In photosynthesis, plants use light energy to produce glucose from carbon dioxide. The glucose is stored mainly in the form of starch granules, in plastids such as chloroplasts and especially amyloplasts.

title: Support Sustainable Development
synopsis: Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the global partnership for sustainable development.

title: Sustainable Consumption
synopsis: Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable.

title: Sustainable Development Goals
synopsis: The Sustainable Development Goals are a proposed set of targets relating to future international development. They are to replace the Millennium Development Goals once they expire at the end of 2015. The proposal contained 17 goals with 169 targets covering a broad range of sustainable development issues.

title: Sustainable Energy for All
synopsis: Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all.

title: Taiga
synopsis: A biome densely filled with spruce trees, fern and large fern. Wolves tend to spawn here fairly commonly - [http://minecraft.gamepedia.com/Ice_Plains_Spikes#Cold_biomes gamepedia]

title: Taiga M
synopsis: Mountainous version of the snowless [[Taiga]] biome.

title: Teachers
synopsis: Salvatore is a designer, robotics engineer, artist, hacker and principal and co-founder of Art is Open Source.

title: Terrain Generation
synopsis: Whenever the game has to generate a new world, it calls upon an algorithm. This algorithm will output a pseudo-random value that is then used to determine what the world will look like. However, the algorithm will always end up with the same value if the starting point (seed) that the algorithm uses is the same number. This is why seeds exist-to easily generate entirely different worlds from a single value.

title: The Breathing Earth
synopsis: [[The Breathing Earth]] is a nice visualisation of the seasonal cycles of the earth from outer space - showing how the earth and it's living ecosystem "breathes". A nice portrait of [[Gaia]] - [http://earthtoparis.org arthtoparis.org]

title: The Sound Of Bees
synopsis: Here we will explore the forthcoming networked event in London, which weaves a number of themes into one overpowering sound. [[Drone]] is the meme and name of the event.

synopsis: Voxel.js is a collection of projects that make it easier than ever to create 3D voxel games like [[Minecraft]] all in the browser - [http://voxeljs.com/ voxeljs.com]

title: Water and Sanitation for All
synopsis: Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all.

synopsis: Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages.

synopsis: These world sites are pictured as [[Parallel Worlds]]. The assumption is that they will be their own [[Minecraft Server]], with a community of up to 1,000 people taking part in the construction.

title: Young People
synopsis: Today one person in five is between the ages of 15 and 24 years. Altogether there are over one billion youth and they constitute a formidable force.
